title: Game didnt respond in loading screen > PC restarted > suddenly ToS screen?
body:
I don't know, this looks very fishy to me.

I'm playing for a few years now and never did something like that ever happen to me. Is there a reason this pops up now, after I've even played a game today without any real issues? Is there a chance I run into any scam when accepting? It also feels weird that there's apparently an update running in the background.

I don't want to send a support ticket for this, as I rather hope for a more immediate response/help.

https://i.imgur.com/VCiEiFL.png

Edit: accepting the ToS brings up a screen where it tells me that desktop icons will be updated and that admin permission might be requested. I'm really scared now, please help.

https://i.imgur.com/KG4xYo1.png

replies.body:
Grayamir has offered some solid advice, I really wouldn't worry about this.  The prompts that you're getting is common when the legacy client updates to the updated version.  The updated client is also cool in that it can quickly apply updates or hotfixes seamlessly without needing to relog, so you might see processes in the background.  

The shortcut prompt is a request to change the old League of Legends icon to the new picture and pathway, but it needs your permission to do that.  Hope that helps offer some ease.

Don't panic.

This is normal, sometimes patches change things in the ToS, so you have to "re-read" it and accept the changes.

The update in background is how the newer client patches.
Problem is, I already patched it today and played a game. So now seeing it patching again and suddenly asking for permissions feels rather odd to me.

Your second image where it says desktop icons will be updated makes me fairly certain it's just updating your client to the new one, that's most likely the main reason for all the ToS stuff popping up.

It has to update the client to new one before it can patch the game itself. There may be a lot of updates to get through, it's been a while since new client was released.

*Since the post title says computer restarted, it's possible your computer system restored itself to an older version?
i doubt it. the loading screen states that i'm already on 7.18
Another possibility is the game repaired itself, which it will do after crashing. Hasn't happened to me in a while, can't recall the specifics of that.
